title: The Baby Formula Fiasco Is a Lesson in Planning and Incentives
sub_head: The risk-reward distortion exists at every level of government.
body:
Regarding Holman Jenkins, Jr.’s “One Bad Choice and a Baby Formula Crisis” (Business World, May 21): Competent management at the FDA would have had a contingency plan in place to address such situations as arose at Abbott Laboratories . Preauthorized foreign suppliers should have been called into play immediately, avoiding the delays of a reactive approval process. It’s common sense.
Roger Baier
